meanings.definition: Excessive exultation over one's success or achievements.
meanings.sent1: His triumphalism after winning the game was evident in his loud celebrations.
meanings.sent2: The team's triumphalism was contagious, spreading joy throughout the stadium.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't contain her triumphalism after acing the test, doing a little victory dance.
meanings.sent4: The company's triumphalism in their quarterly report was reflected in their soaring stock prices.
meanings.sent5: The child's triumphalism upon receiving a gold star was heartwarming to witness.

meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of the superiority of a particular group or ideology.
meanings.sent1: The triumphalism of the political party led to division among the citizens.
meanings.sent2: His triumphalism about his favorite sports team made him biased in discussions.
meanings.sent3: The triumphalism of the exclusive club members made outsiders feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent4: The triumphalism of the elite group created a sense of exclusivity and entitlement.
meanings.sent5: The triumphalism of the organization alienated those who did not share their views.
